place.name: HASGUARD
place.gazetteerText: HASGUARD, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; near the coast, 4½ miles WNW of Milford, and 6 W by S of Johnston r. station. Post town, Herbrandston, under Milford. Acres, 1, 475. Real property, £1, 582. Pop., 125. Houses, 23. Hasguard House is a chief residence. Several points command a fine view of the coast. Theliving is a rectory in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £106. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
